item.title: Making MAPE More Meaningful
item.description: “You can’t manage what you can’t measure”, which is why it’s important for businesses to measure forecast accuracy. For those unaware, MAPE (Mean Absolute Percentage Error) is one of the three most common forecast accuracy measures along with bias and MSE. It is also a proxy for measuring the demand planning value-add in an FMCG businesses. That is, when the MAPE score is favourable (low), then demand planning’s value-add for a business must be high.

item.title: Measuring Demand Planning Behaviours
item.description: What’s better; making the wrong decision for the right reasons or making the right decision for the wrong reasons? If it’s one-off, then the right decision for the wrong reasons (also known as a fluke), is likely to receive plaudits. However, if it’s part of a decision making process recurring every month, such as sales forecasting, then I’ll back the wrong decision for the right reasons (also known as bad luck) every time.
